_header: Go forth thy way my faithful desirance
_description:
A roundel, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 46) — 21 lines

BLHar682.First Lines:
GO forth thi way my feithfull deservaunceOn that thow owist me thyn
                    obeysaunce…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…To shorte thi way also and thee to lereTake to thi gide swete
                    remembraunce
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-3 at end to indicate going back to first five lines of the roundel.
